title: Engineering Terms Quiz
description: Explore the vocabulary of engineering, from structural concepts and materials science to design principles and construction techniques.

questions.question: What does 'tensile strength' measure?
options: The weight a structure can support
The maximum stress a material can withstand while being stretched before breaking

questions.question: What is a 'cantilever'?
options: A beam anchored at only one end, with the other end extending freely

questions.question: What does 'tolerance' mean in engineering?
options: The weight capacity of a structure
The permissible limit of variation in a dimension or measurement

questions.question: What is 'hydraulics'?
options: The science of using pressurized liquid to generate force and motion

questions.question: What is a 'load-bearing wall'?
options: A wall made of reinforced concrete
A wall that supports the weight of the structure above it

questions.question: What does 'fatigue' mean when referring to materials?
options: The expansion of metal in heat
A material becoming heavier over time
The weakening of a material caused by repeated stress cycles

questions.question: What is a 'schematic'?
options: A simplified diagram showing the elements of a system using symbols

questions.question: What is 'torque' in mechanical engineering?
options: A twisting force that causes rotation

questions.question: What does 'calibration' involve?
options: Adjusting a measuring instrument to ensure accuracy

questions.question: What is a 'prototype'?
options: An early model or sample built to test a concept or design
The final version of a product

questions.question: What does 'aerodynamic' describe?
options: Designed to reduce air resistance and move efficiently through air

questions.question: What is 'ductility'?
options: The weight of a material per unit volume
The ability of a material to resist heat
The ability of a material to be drawn into thin wires without breaking

questions.question: What is a 'truss' in structural engineering?
options: A framework of beams forming triangles to support a structure

questions.question: What does 'CAD' stand for in engineering?
What is 'corrosion'?
options: The wearing away of rock by water
The gradual destruction of a material by chemical reaction with its environment
The bending of a metal beam
The cracking of concrete from cold
